result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jovan Dion Barrs in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Jovan Dion Barrs.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury trial.  Attorney Graber appears by zoom not feeling well and is requesting an adjournment.  Court granted adjournment.  Case is adjourned to 1-17-23 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Defense is requesting a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Defense is requesting the no contact order be dropped.  Victim is requesting the no contact order be dropped.  Court denied requests to drop the no contact order.  
  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 9-13-22 at 1:30 pm  for final pretrial and 10-3-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM033200  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff
07/02/2022

Defendant Jovan Dion Barrs in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jovan Dion Barrs appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defense's Bail Motion held.  Arguments heard.  Additional statement from victim.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defense's bail motion.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10:
Defendant Jovan Dion Barrs in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Jovan Dion Barrs in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer L. Wourms. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jovan Dion Barrs in court with Attorney Katherine Graber; both appear by video.  Defendant Jovan Dion Barrs in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; on vacation. Defense objects to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Court ordered no contact with GSW (5.4.1963)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Jovan Dion Barrs in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Jovan Dion Barrs in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jovan Dion Barrs appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 10.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
